subject: Productivity
title: Commitment Escalation
description: A quick win: understand Commitment Escalation.

hook.text: The Concorde jet lost money for decades. Britain and France kept funding it because they'd already spent billions.

buildup.text: Escalation of commitment means increasing investment in a failing course of action to justify past investment.

discovery.text: Barry Staw's research showed that decision makers double down on failing strategies to avoid admitting mistakes.

twist.text: The sunk cost fallacy feeds this: the more you've invested, the harder it is to walk away, even when you should.

climax.text: Strategic prioritizers ask: knowing what I know now, would I start this today? If not, it's time to stop.

punchline.text: Past investment is spent. Only future value matters now.

quiz.question: What drives escalation of commitment?
options: Desire to justify past investment and avoid admitting mistakes
